title: Centre for Quantum Technology Research
description: Funding is provided for research centres focused on basic research activities in quantum technology, aiming to build strong Norwegian academic communities in fields like quantum computing and sensors.
detailed_overview: The purpose of this call is to establish solid Norwegian academic communities conducting high-international-level research in quantum computing, quantum sensors, and quantum communication. Norway requires strong academic communities that conduct groundbreaking research in quantum technology, alongside increased recruitment to the field. Funding is specifically available for research centres focusing on basic research activities in mathematical, natural sciences, and/or technological research.
eligibility: Funding under this call is available for research centres focusing on basic research activities in mathematical, natural sciences and/or technological research.
application_requirements: Focus on basic research activities in quantum technology
Use of provided templates for submission

title: Proof of Concept Grants in AI or Quantum technologies
description: The grant supports academic scientists in AI or Quantum technologies to develop early-stage discoveries towards validated methods, products, or processes, bridging the gap from research to innovation.
detailed_overview: This is a directed Proof of Concept call opened by the Knut & Alice Wallenberg Foundation (KAW) in collaboration with WASP and WACQT. The purpose is to bridge the gap from academic research to innovation, allowing researchers the opportunity to develop their early-stage discoveries towards validated methods, products or processes. The grant provides the opportunity to carry out activities that validate and accelerate the development of the project and prepare for innovation and commercialization. The grant is tied to the Wallenberg Launch Pad (WALP) mechanism and will be paid directly to the researcher's university, complying with the university's regulations, the Swedish professor’s privilege, and KAW's specific terms and conditions.
eligibility: Eligible to apply are scientists that are employed at a Swedish University and have or have had grants from the Wallenberg Foundations (Wallenberg Academy Fellows, Wallenberg Scholars, Wallenberg Clinical Scholars, PI and Co PIs in KAW projects) Or are part of KAWs strategic initiatives (Wallenberg AI, Autonomous Systems and Software Program (WASP), Wallenberg Centre for Quantum Technology (WACQT), Wallenberg Initiative Material Science for Sustainability (WISE), Wallenberg Wood Science Cente (WWSC), Wallenberg Centers for Molecular Medicine (WCMM), Data Driven Life Science (DDLS)).
application_requirements: Affiliation with a Wallenberg Foundation grant (Wallenberg Academy Fellows, Wallenberg Scholars, Wallenberg Clinical Scholars, PI and Co PIs in KAW projects)
Affiliation with a KAW strategic initiative (WASP, WACQT, WISE, WWSC, WCMM, DDLS)

title: U.S.-UK Center-to-Centre Collaboration Opportunities for Artificial Intelligence and Quantum Information Science and Technology
description: This opportunity supports collaboration between research centers in the U.S. and the U.K. focusing on advancements in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Quantum Information Science and Technology (QIST).
detailed_overview: This program, likely issued through a Dear Colleague Letter (DCL) or similar mechanism, seeks to establish robust center-to-centre research partnerships between institutions in the United States and the United Kingdom. The focus areas are the strategic fields of Artificial Intelligence and Quantum Information Science and Technology, promoting joint research, knowledge sharing, and capacity building between the two nations. The full program details, including specific goals, budget limitations, and submission instructions, are missing due to the truncation of the source text.
eligibility: Not specified in provided text (Typically academic and research institutions for NSF center programs.)

title: Faculty Upskilling Fellowships in AI and Quantum Sciences
